snippet.title: Boy writes adorable letter applying for job at NASA
snippet.content:
NASA recently announced it was looking for someone to be a "planetary protection officer". One little kid reckons it should be him. Picture: NASA/AFP
FOLLOWING NASA's recent announcement that it is looking for someone to be an effective guardian of the galaxy, one applicant send the space agency a particularly adorable letter. Hoping to have a shot , this little boy decided to take his chances and wrote to NASA, the reported. He doesn't think his age should be an obstacle. "I may be nine, but I think I would be fit for the job. One of the reasons is my sister says I am an alien also, I have seen almost all the space and alien movies I can see," he wrote.
This could be the most adorable job application you'll ever read. Picture: Reddit/millamberSource:Reddit
Jack makes a very good case. Picture: Reddit/millamberSource:Reddit "I have also seen the show Marvel Agents of Shield and hope to see the movie Men in Black. I am great at video games. I am young, so I can learn to think like an Alien." Sure, he may lack some of the more technical skills the six-figure-salary job requires but Jack has seen a lot of space movies and is as keen as can be. Your move, NASA.
